titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Richard Benson Sewall Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Robert Bartels and staff of Manuscripts and Archives.

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday April 25, 2019 at 07:15

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers include correspondence, writings, and research materials of Richard Sewall, author of books and other publications relating to Emily Dickinson.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Richard Sewall, 1985, and Emily A. McDermott, 2018.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Student records are restricted until 2060 as established by Yale Corporation regulations http://web.library.yale.edu/mssa/collections/research-use-of-yale-university-archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Richard Benson Sewall Papers (MS 1413). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers include correspondence and research materials relating to Sewall's scholarship of Emily Dickinson, other areas of poetry and English literature, and the family of Augustus Hopkins Strong, Sewall's maternal grandfather. Also includes correspondence between Sewall and colleagues and former students, and lectures given to various organizations on Emily Dickinson and other topics. Includes course material relating to classes taught by Dr. Sewall at Yale University, including a class on tragedy in literature.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Richard Benson Sewall served as an English professor at Yale University for more than 40 years. Sewall taught undergraduate courses on English literature, including a course on tragedy in literature. Sewall was also a scholar of Emily Dickinson; his biography of her, The Life of Emily Dickinson , was published in 1974 and won the United States National Book Award in Biography. Sewall came from a family of Congregational ministers; his grandfather was the Reverend Augustus Hopkins Strong. Sewall retired from Yale in 1976 and died in 2003.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material is arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This accession comprises lecture notes and course materials documenting Sewall's tenure as a Yale University professor of English; writings and research files on Emily Dickinson, the Strong family of Rochester, New York, and other areas relating to Sewall's research interests; and correspondence regarding Sewall's research and work at Yale. Also includes personal materials documenting Sewall's professional life and family history.
